questions.question_text:
A project using a hybrid approach to migrate from a current system to a new and enhanced system is underway. The plan is to migrate the system in stages. However, the operations team is complaining that they are not ready to start supporting the new system.

How should the project manager effectively approach this situation?

choices.C: Change the project management plan to add a final stage for product handoff to the operations team.
choices.D: Create a lessons learned register to include operations team training for future projects.
choices.B: Prepare detailed documentation to be shared with the operations team during project closure.
choices.A: Include knowledge transfer sessions between the project and operations teams at every stage.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Include knowledge transfer sessions between the project and operations teams at every stage

Selected Answer: A
C cannot be answer as it require Change control process.
So, A is best option to solve this issue in current project.

questions.question_text:
A project manager is working on the delivery of a solution that needs to be deployed to the public quickly. The project team is experienced, the stakeholders are supporting the delivery, and the customer is cooperating.
What strategy should the project manager use to ensure on-time delivery of the solution?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
An incremental plan with customer responses will be the best option since we want the project delivered on time.

Selected Answer: C
C as it would be agile

The project team is experienced & strict deadline
-> Dont really need a detailed

Selected Answer: C
The other information provided aside "QUICKLY" are distractors. The intent is to deliver quickly, if you go too detailed as D suggested, then very unlikely you're delivering QUICKLY. With C, you will deliver quickly maybe not evrything but many MVPs

Selected Answer: D
D is the answer

D The problem is with the word delivery. Does this mean development or roll-out? I saw "delivery of a solution" as a the solution is there and it is roll-out where predictive would provide for a set plan to follow. If you see delivery as development then agile incremental and thus C.

Selected Answer: D
Why not D?

Selected Answer: D

Any risk with C? What if during the implementation it turns out that detail requirement/expectation are much complex than that initially assessed? "Supporting/Cooperating" doesn't mean all parties agreed to work with adaptive approach and doesn't ensure the stakeholders and client would give up their points for the shake of meeting deadline.

Selected Answer: C
C. Have a high-level plan for incremental deliveries and get the customer's feedback as early as possible
D one time delivery is key word here to go with predictive

Quick delivery means need to use incremental method. Incremental method ensure you to at least delivery value to customer at first, so C

comments.content: The 1980's called and asked for its PM experience back. uncertainty is one aspect of using agile. Another reason is speed. (i.e. "...deployed to the public quickly).

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Mmmmhhh.. How can you "ensure on-time delivery of the solution" if you have no schedule, planning etc etc? A proper planning is the first thing to do in order to be sure of the delivery timing.
To use an Agile approach? Why? I don't read about any uncertainty about the scope so we can use the predictive approach...

Selected Answer: C
C. Have a high-level plan for incremental deliveries and get the customer's feedback as early as possible.

By adopting an incremental delivery approach and seeking customer feedback early in the process, the project manager can obtain valuable input to guide the development and ensure alignment with the customer's requirements. This iterative approach enables early detection and resolution of any misunderstandings, potential issues, or changes in priorities, reducing the risk of rework or delays later in the project.

This strategy capitalizes on the experienced project team, stakeholder support, and customer cooperation. It allows the project manager to leverage their expertise and foster collaboration between the project team and the customer throughout the development process, ensuring that the solution meets the customer's needs and expectations while maintaining a focus on timely delivery.

questions.question_text:
A project manager is assigned to a project to develop a mobile app. The sponsor explains that the application should do better than their closest competitor’s app. The sponsor’s expectation is that the team can be put together and start work immediately.

What should the project manager do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Scope must be defined first in this case.

Selected Answer: D
D. Review the competitor's app to understand the functionalities that the project scope should consider

comments.content:
1.First: collect requirement (Option D)
2.Second: define scope (Option A)

discussion.content:
1.First: collect requirement (Option A)
2.Second: define scope (Option B)

Selected Answer: A
In this situation, the best first step for the project manager is:

A. Define the project scope with the stakeholders and determine how formal acceptance will be obtained.

Here's why:

Option B: While resource planning is important, it should be based on a clearly defined project scope. Otherwise, you might risk assigning the wrong resources or misaligning their skills with the actual needs.
Option C: Estimating effort and budget without a defined scope might lead to inaccurate numbers and potentially unrealistic expectations.
Option D: Reviewing the competitor's app can be helpful later, but it shouldn't be the first step before understanding the project's own goals and expectations.

Selected Answer: D
I choose D, as this question is related to Benchmarking.

Ans B
I would go with B. Much of the scope is already there in terms of competitor app. The stakeholder's "Expectation" is that the team can be put together. But team is not there yet. So the first thing for Project manager is to get the resources ready. Then they can focus on evaluating competitor app, freeze scope etc. That said, my choice for this situation is B.

Selected Answer: D
Need to compare with the competitor to make sure our product still relevant in the market

Selected Answer: D
Reviewing the competitor's app helps gather insights into the functionalities that are currently successful in the market. This understanding can serve as a foundational step in defining the project scope, as it provides crucial information on what the app should incorporate to surpass the competitor's offering. Subsequently, defining project scope (option A) and other planning activities can follow once this initial analysis is complete.

Selected Answer: D
I agree with D. If you are told that you need to a better app than XYZ, the first thing you will do is download XYZ to check out the app. And only after that you are familiar with the basics of the app, you can invite for a workshop to define the scope with other stakeholders.

Selected Answer: A
According to Chatgpt
In the initial phase of the project, it is crucial to clearly define the project scope with the stakeholders. Understanding the sponsor's expectations is important, and defining the scope helps in clarifying what is included and excluded from the project. This step is essential for preventing scope creep and ensuring that the team and stakeholders have a shared understanding of project objectives.

Options B, C, and D are also important tasks in project management, but they typically come later in the project planning process. Before resource management planning, estimating effort and budget, or reviewing competitors' apps, it's crucial to establish a well-defined project scope.

choices.A: Define the project scope with the stakeholders and determine how formal acceptance will be obtained
choices.D: Review the competitor's app to understand the functionalities that the project scope should consider
choices.B: Start working on the resource management plan in order to identify the best team for the project.
choices.C: Utilize expert judgment and organizational process assets (OPAs) to estimate the effort and budget

En escaladant le problème auprès des sponsors du projet et du gestionnaire de la partie prenante, le chef de projet senior peut clarifier les rôles et responsabilités, et s'assurer que les communications passent par les canaux appropriés. I choose C, I want to speak with the sponsor and the key stakeholder, and I want their commitment that they agree to the realization plan. If they agree, then I hope the key stakeholder will not longer bypasses the senior project manager, because he has agreed to the plan.

In this situation, where a key stakeholder is bypassing the senior project manager and giving instructions directly to other project managers, it's essential to address the issue through escalation. Escalating the matter to the project sponsors and the manager of the stakeholder will help bring attention to the situation and seek a resolution at a higher level. This ensures that proper communication channels and project management hierarchy are respected, and it may lead to a more effective resolution of the issue.

Selected Answer: B
The senior PM needs to know where this stakeholder's place is in the world he can make the appropriate approach to the situation.

Ans A

Selected Answer: B
This approach will allow the senior project manager to gain insights into the stakeholder's influence and motivations, helping in developing a more tailored strategy to address the situation effectively.
B: Analyze first

questions.question_text:
A senior project manager is assigned to lead a team of project managers to run a large initiative. One of the key stakeholders often bypasses the senior project manager and girves instructions to the other project managers directly.

What should the senior project manager do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Ensured that communications were sent to all stakeholders when requirements change

Selected Answer: D
its about communication management plan

Selected Answer: D
Proactively communicating changes in requirements to all stakeholders, including the procurement team, is critical in ensuring alignment between evolving project needs and procurement activities. This proactive communication aids in preventing discrepancies between purchased items and updated project specifications.

Selected Answer: D
D is the answer as it shows better execution of communication management plan.
B is part of monitor and control phase which is reactive if plan/execution is not proper.

Selected Answer: B
Had it been monitored communication would have happened.

choices.C: Ensured procurement contracts were able be canceled when situations like this arise
choices.A: Ensured project requirements were validated and communicated with the procurement team
choices.D: Ensured that communications were sent to all stakeholders when requirements change
choices.B: Ensured changing stakeholder needs and requests were properly monitored
